page.title: 13Telscombe 'Years of Change'
page.content: Little has changed since 1918 when Miss Gregory moved into Telscombe. Four cottages were built in the early 1920's and a barn has been converted to a house. The village school built to accomodate 24 pupils closed in the early 1960's. Miss Gregory told us that one stayed at the village school for all of one's school life unless (like her) one won a place at Lewes Grammar school. The village has only been served by local buses since the 1980's so most people have their own transport. Before the Second World War most of the village was involved in Racing stables, the training gallops being on the Downs. However during the war the Downs were ploughed up for food production unfortunately this brought a lot of flints to the surface, making it unusable for the horses.
